Kenneth Stanley wrote:

>[stuff about input nodes]
>
>I think this discussion is mostly semantics; the "input array" is just
>another word for "inputs" in NEAT.  In other words, one might ask you,
>"why not have incoming connections to the input array?"  But the point
>is, at some level, the inputs are just the inputs.  In NEAT, the
>"input nodes" are that level.
>
>My advice is to follow the NEAT conventions unless there is a very
>good functional reason not to, because that way it will be easier for
>you to ask questions, since then the less your system diverges from
>the ones that already exist.  On the other hand, if some design
>decision I made was really poor, it is certainly reasonable to try
>something different.
>
>  
>
I agree it's a good idea to not stry too far from the pack. As you say 
it's really just semantics, if I use an input signal array then 
connections have to carry an extra bit to distinguish between node 
conenctions and input signal connections. It's a /slightly/ clearer way 
I suppose but not significantly moreso than placing an input bit on the 
node structure.

Thanks again for the feedback. I have a week clear now to put something 
together.

Colin
